description: Development of SpiderOak One has been stale for quite a while. But they seem to be working on it more now. It's very efficient. Set it and forget it.
Stable, and reliable. They have unlimited one price annual packages, which I love. Great application. Great company.
summary: The remote backup solution of choice

description: This platform is a work of art, a literal masterpiece. I would never use anything else. SpiderOak ROCKS!
summary: Best backup product on the market

description: Their software is so bad it makes their service horrible. It is sad because the idea is great and their Linux support is good, but the application is equally bad on all platforms. It doesn't give notifications on what it is doing and that is horrible for an application you will depend on to always be working and if it isn't it should tell you.

Canceled my unlimited account for protecting 12TB of data with only 2 weeks notice. If your infrastructure is so poor that you can't support a 12TB account, don't sell an unlimited plan... and if you do anyway, do the right thing and honor those who give you their money and use it as an opportunity to improve your service!
summary: Great concept, not a good company

description:
It does have glitches from time to time on Debian stable. But overall, it's saved me a lot of time and effort as a backup solution. 

500MB free account... paid subscriptions are ridiculously cheap... 2TB for $14/month, and that's just one of several offerings in the non-commercial plans. Business offerings are rolling out as of Spring 2021, i.e. CrossClave (competes with Google's suite of collaboration products).

Great company. I first heard of it from Snowden (he was allowed to do a code audit, from what I understand). 

Now even the US Air Force uses it.

A pesar de que es privativa, a no ser que tengas posibilidad de crear tu propio servicio usando nextcloud o alguno de los libres que hay, es difícil encontrar un servicio online como estos con buen soporte en linux, este funciona y tiene buen precio.
